plugins.name: Figma to Website(Powered by EdgeOne Pages)
plugins.description:
Convert your Figma designs into clean, responsive HTML code and publish them instantly to the web. This plugin bridges the gap between design and deployment.


Key Features:

• One-click code generation with Tailwind CSS styling

• Instant web publishing to EdgeOne Pages

• Responsive design preservation

• Real-time preview before publishing

• Copy-friendly code output


Perfect for designers, developers, and teams who need rapid design-to-web workflows for prototyping, landing pages, and showcasing interactive designs.


Based on the open-source Figma to Code project(https://github.com/bernaferrari/FigmaToCode), with hosting powered by EdgeOne Pages(https://edgeone.ai/products/pages).


Explore the source code at: https://github.com/TencentEdgeOne/figma-to-website
plugins.tagline: Transform your Figma designs into ready-to-deploy websites with one-click publishing

plugins.name: GIF Export (static or animated)
plugins.description:
Turn your designs into animated GIFs in just a few clicks.


This plugin is designed for designers who need to quickly export simple animations from multiple frames in Figma. With an intuitive interface, you can import your frames, adjust the time between frames, set compression, and create instant previews — all without leaving Figma.


Ideal for creating animated banners, UI mockups, visual demos, and more. With compression support, local preview, and optimized export, you have full control over the final size and fluidity of your GIF.


Key features:


  1. Import multiple frames directly from Figma
  2. Configure delay between frames and infinite loop option
  3. Adjustable compression for quality and size control
  4. Preview directly in the plugin before exporting
  5. Local export with real-time preview


Lightweight, practical, and focused on productivity — your shortcut to creating GIFs directly from Figma.
plugins.tagline: Export animated or static GIFs directly from Figma without complications.

Ideal for creating animated banners, UI mockups, visual demos, and more. With compression support, local preview, and optimized export, you have full control over the final size and fluidity of your GIF.


Key features:


  1. Import multiple frames directly from Figma
  2. Configure delay between frames and infinite loop option
  3. Adjustable compression for quality and size control
  4. Preview directly in the plugin before exporting
  5. Local export with real-time preview


Lightweight, practical, and focused on productivity — your shortcut to creating GIFs directly from Figma.
134489.tagline: Export animated or static GIFs directly from Figma without complications.

plugins.name: Figma to Shopify with Foxify - Shopify Smart Visual Page Builder
plugins.description:
Figma to Shopify with Foxify Visual Page Builder


Ship responsive and optimized pixel-perfect Shopify pages and sections in seconds with the Figma to Shopify with Foxify plugin by FoxEcom.


Copy any Figma design, paste it into the Foxify page builder, and publish it live with 1-click.


No code needed.


Install Foxify Visual Builder free now!


How it works

  1. Set up: Design pages or sections in Figma, and install the plugin
  2. Copy & paste: Copy the design, then paste it into Foxify editor with 1-click!
  3. Publish: Polish your design, and publish it as pages or sections


Video tutorial

  1. How to convert Figma design to Shopify


Support

  1. We’re happy to help with any questions or queries at happytohelp@foxecom.com


Design with Auto layout

  1. In your Figma design, use Auto Layout as much as possible. This will convert all layers to responsive Shopify elements later.

accepted.name: FoxEcom
accepted.description: FoxEcom is an agile Shopify team that develops smart & hyper-efficien solutions for SMB markets.

plugins.tagline: Copy any winning design, paste, and done! 5x faster, 98% precision, 100% free.

Copy any Figma design, paste it into the Foxify page builder, and publish it live with 1-click.


No code needed.


Install Foxify Visual Builder free now!


How it works

  1. Set up: Design pages or sections in Figma, and install the plugin
  2. Copy & paste: Copy the design, then paste it into Foxify editor with 1-click!
  3. Publish: Polish your design, and publish it as pages or sections


Video tutorial

  1. How to convert Figma design to Shopify


Support

  1. We’re happy to help with any questions or queries at happytohelp@foxecom.com


Design with Auto layout

plugins.name: Quick Prototype
plugins.description:
Perfect for designers who want to quickly create interactive prototypes without the tedious task of manually connecting each frame. Boost your productivity and focus more on design iterations rather than prototype setup.


Key features


  1. Instantly connect multiple frames in sequence
  2. Intelligently sorts frames based on position
  3. Creates smooth smart animate transitions
  4. Works with frames and instances
  5. Works with both top-level frames and nested frames (frames inside other frames).
plugins.tagline: Essential keyboard shortcut to add interactions in series

123304.name: Quick Prototype
123304.description:
Perfect for designers who want to quickly create interactive prototypes without the tedious task of manually connecting each frame. Boost your productivity and focus more on design iterations rather than prototype setup.


Key features


  1. Instantly connect multiple frames in sequence
  2. Intelligently sorts frames based on position
  3. Creates smooth smart animate transitions
  4. Works with frames and instances
  5. Works with both top-level frames and nested frames (frames inside other frames).
123304.release_notes: Nested Frame Support. The plugin can work with both top-level frames and nested frames (frames inside other frames).
123304.tagline: Essential keyboard shortcut to add interactions in series

plugins.name: Slice by guides
plugins.description:
You can use this plugin to create slices along horizontal Guidelines. This is a convenient tool for further export of the sliced ​​layout.


Instructions:

1) Select the Frame that you want to divide into slices.

2) Add Guidelines, along which the division into slices will be carried out in the future.

3) Run the plugin.


The result of the plugin's work is the "Slice" elements added in the selected Frame, which can be used for export. To do this, simply select these slices and export them in a format convenient for you.
plugins.tagline: Creates slices inside a Frame along horizontal Guidelines

97337.name: Slice by guides
97337.description:

Instructions:

3) Run the plugin.

97337.tagline: Creates slices inside a Frame along horizontal Guidelines

plugins.name: Cover Letter Panda
plugins.description:
Improve your chances of getting hired with a professional cover letter

Cover Letter Panda helps you generate a professional UX designer cover letter in seconds.


How to use

Simply paste in the job description of the job you are applying to. Optionally, add any relevant experience you have, such as experience in the same industry.


Each cover lettter is in A4 format and be exported as a PDF right away.


Get started for free

Cover Letter Panda comes with 2 free cover letter generations. You can gain additional credits for free, or purchase 20 credits for $20. If you are in a position where you can not afford the credits, please contact me.


Questions & Support

If you have any questions or feedback, please contact me at clpanda@uiuxdesignerjobs.com


Attribution

Panda Bear icon designed by G-CAT https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/panda-bear_12783443?term=panda via flaticon

accepted.description: Reach out to me on joseph@sitemapgecko.com !

plugins.name: TagIt: Tags Manager
plugins.description:
TagIt is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of organizing and managing tags for design elements within Figma documents.


Buy me coffee


  • Assign Tags: Easily assign tags to any node in the document, including frames, groups, or individual elements.
  • One-Click Selection: Quickly select all nodes associated with a specific tag with just one click, facilitating easy editing and synchronization.
  • Create and Edit Tags: Create new tags on the fly or modify existing ones to tailor the tagging system to your workflow.
  • Color Customization: Assign colors to tags for visual differentiation and organization.
  • Reorder Tags: Arrange tags in the desired order to maintain organization and hierarchy.
  • CSV Import and Export: Seamlessly import and export tags via CSV files for efficient bulk management.


Example Usage:

  • Tag multiple instances of a design element, such as "Primary Button" across different frames or groups.
  • Use TagIt to quickly select all "primary buttons" with a single click, facilitating swift editing and customization.

accepted.name: Sunny
accepted.description: Solving some of the use cases my team encounters when working in Figma.

plugins.tagline: Assign tags, find and select with tags, modify

If you have any questions, you can contact us. Our website address is: Image Placeholder.

plugins.name: Design Pulse
plugins.description:
Automatically check and maintain design consistency across your Figma files. This plugin helps you ensure that all elements follow your design system guidelines.


Key Features:

• Color Styles - Ensure colors are linked to styles

• Typography - Check text styles consistency

• Effects - Validate shadow and blur styles

• Spacing - Check auto-layout spacing variables

• Storke - Verify stroke style usage

• Corner Radius - Validate radius consistency


How to use:

1. Select any frame in your design

2. Click "Run Checker"

3. Review the results

4. Click on any item to inspect and fix inconsistencies


Perfect for:

✓ Design System Managers

✓ UI/UX Designers

✓ Design QA

✓ Team Leads


The plugin provides real-time feedback and makes it easy to maintain design consistency across your projects.
plugins.tagline: Keep your design system's heartbeat strong

plugins.name: Figvar
plugins.description:
Figvar makes it easy to work with Figma variables and components that use them:

  1. Variable inspector with support for local and library variables
  2. Search, replace, edit, create

  4. Package and deploy components with variables pre-wired

plugins.name: How You Use Color
plugins.description:
How you actually use color?


Usage:

  1. Select one component and click GENERATE, and pixels will be reorganized as bar.
  2. Hover on each block to see percentage of area each color occupied in that component.


Note:

  • Only one random component will be pick if multiple are selected.
  • There is a color are picked with some hardcoded tolerance at this moment, so might not be one hundred percent accurate. And we are considering to expose tolerance as input in future update.
plugins.tagline: Check your color usage in percentage!

62321.description:

  2. Hover on each block to see percentage of area each color occupied in that component.


Note:

  • There is a color are picked with some hardcoded tolerance at this moment, so might not be one hundred percent accurate. And we are considering to expose tolerance as input in future update.
62321.tagline: Check your color usage in percentage!

plugins.name: design-tokens.io Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
This is the Figma plugin for design-tokens.io


design-tokens.io is the real-time hub for your Design Tokens.


Ensure design consistency across multiple brands, themes and projects.

Accelerate release cycles through seamless handoffs between designers and developers.

Built for agencies and enterprise design teams.


Consistency across all brands

Keep a single source of truth for all your Design Tokens. All your themes stay 100% interchangable, by default.


Seamless import & export

Import and export your Design Tokens as W3C-compliant JSON. Avoid vendor lock-in.


Real-time collaboration

Multiple users manage Design Tokens, themes and brands at the same time. No workflow bottlenecks, no data conflicts.


Bridge design and development

Designers sync their Design Tokens with Figma variables in real-time. Developers receive CSS/SASS variables. No manual handoffs necessary.



FAQs


What if I already use Figma Variables?

That’s fine! Our platform natively supports Figma Variables while protecting you from their limited scalability and interoperability. It acts as a single-source-of-truth for all your Design Tokens and integrates with all your tools, not just Figma.


I only use the free Figma plan. Will this work for me?

Yes! Our Figma plugin works with every Figma plan, even the free one. It lets you import your Design Tokens into Figma and sync your changes in real-time, no matter how many tokens, themes and brands you manage.


Why not use Tokens Studio?

Tokens Studio is great, but it is primarily a Figma plugin - intended to be used by Figma users from within Figma. It even stores all your Design Tokens inside Figma.

Our platform takes the opposite approach: It is a standalone, single-purpose data hub that lets your whole team collaborate on your Design Tokens and syncs them to all your tools, not just Figma.


We're already using Supernova. Is this compatible?

Absolutely! You can start using our platform in tandem with Supernova today, since Supernova will import your Design Tokens from Figma as usual. We're also working on a native Supernova hook that will make the process even more seamless!


Is the platform W3C-compliant?

Yes! Our platform ensures maximum interoperability with all your other tools by being fully compliant with the latest version of the W3C Design Tokens specification. You can seamlessly import and export Design Tokens as W3C DTCG JSON.


What's the learning curve for my team?

Our platform is reportedly much easier to use than comparable tools and was designed from the ground up to make managing and accessing Design Tokens as simple as possible.

You will be up and running in a matter of minutes. Watch demo
plugins.tagline: Auto-sync your Design Tokens from design-tokens.io to Figma

plugins.name: Styles Manager
plugins.description:
Effortless Style Management in Figma


Take full control of your colors, text styles, effects, and grids with Styles Manager – the ultimate tool for organizing, duplicating, and editing styles in Figma. No more manual copying or messy style structures – streamline your workflow and keep everything structured in just a few clicks!


Bulk Duplicate Folders & Styles

  1. Preserve the original hierarchy when duplicating styles and folders.
  2. Keep all Variables links intact for a seamless workflow.


Batch Selection & Actions

  1. Select multiple styles within a folder and apply actions at once.
  2. Duplicate or delete entire groups of styles instantly.


Full Control Over Text Styles

  1. Easily rename, duplicate, and delete text styles.
  2. Maintain the folder structure while working with multiple styles.


Instant Effect Type Recognition

  1. Identify Drop Shadows, Blurs, and Inner Shadows at a glance.
  2. Edit and organize effect styles as easily as colors and fonts.


Manage Grid Styles Efficiently

  1. Quickly duplicate, remove, or organize grid styles while preserving settings.
  2. Select multiple grid styles at once for bulk actions.


Why Use Styles Manager?


  1. Saves time by automating repetitive tasks.
  2. Keeps everything structured – no more lost or unorganized styles.
  3. Ensures consistency across projects with preserved Variables and hierarchy.


Upgrade your workflow and take full control of your Figma styles today!


🔗 Behance

🔗 Dribbble

🔗 Email

accepted.name: Andrei Kuznetsov
accepted.description: Templates, UI Kits, Design Systems, Plugins

plugins.tagline: Effortless Style Management: Duplicate, Delete, and Edit Name of Figma Styles in One Click!

121702.name: Styles Manager
121702.description:
Effortless Style Management in Figma


Take full control of your colors, text styles, effects, and grids with Styles Manager – the ultimate tool for organizing, duplicating, and editing styles in Figma. No more manual copying or messy style structures – streamline your workflow and keep everything structured in just a few clicks!


Bulk Duplicate Folders & Styles

  1. Preserve the original hierarchy when duplicating styles and folders.
  2. Keep all Variables links intact for a seamless workflow.


Batch Selection & Actions

  1. Select multiple styles within a folder and apply actions at once.
  2. Duplicate or delete entire groups of styles instantly.


Full Control Over Text Styles

  1. Easily rename, duplicate, and delete text styles.
  2. Maintain the folder structure while working with multiple styles.


Instant Effect Type Recognition

  1. Identify Drop Shadows, Blurs, and Inner Shadows at a glance.
  2. Edit and organize effect styles as easily as colors and fonts.


Manage Grid Styles Efficiently

  1. Quickly duplicate, remove, or organize grid styles while preserving settings.
  2. Select multiple grid styles at once for bulk actions.


Why Use Styles Manager?


  1. Saves time by automating repetitive tasks.
  2. Keeps everything structured – no more lost or unorganized styles.
  3. Ensures consistency across projects with preserved Variables and hierarchy.


Upgrade your workflow and take full control of your Figma styles today!


🔗 Behance

🔗 Dribbble

🔗 Email
121702.tagline: Effortless Style Management: Duplicate, Delete, and Edit Name of Figma Styles in One Click!

plugins.name: Translate AI
plugins.description:
Translate AI empowers you to effortlessly translate content within your designs using the power of AI. Whether you need to translate entire frames, groups, or components, this plugin streamlines the process, enhancing your design workflow.


Features:

Bulk Translation: Translate all selected content at once, saving you time and effort.

Language Suggestions: Get up to three translation outcomes for better language accuracy.

Versatile Application: Works seamlessly with Frames, Groups, Components, and more.

Important Tips:

Avoid Overloading: Translating excessively large amounts of content at once may cause errors.

Font Selection: Always choose the appropriate font for the language you're translating into to ensure accurate rendering.

plugins.name: Number to Currency Formatter
plugins.description:
Instant Currency Formatter for Figma 💸

Tired of manually formatting numbers into currency? This plugin does it instantly and effortlessly!


How It Works:

  1. Select any text layer (single or multiple ✨) containing numbers.
  2. Choose a currency (INR, USD, EUR, and more).
  3. See a real-time preview (Also in-words!)
  4. Click Convert—instantly formatted with the correct symbol & separators!



Examples:

🔢 240000 → ₹2,40,000 (INR) → "Two Lakh Forty Thousand Rupees"

🔢 1580.75 → $1,580.75 (USD) → "One Thousand Five Hundred Eighty Dollars and Seventy-Five Cents"

🔢 3499.99 → 3.499,99 € (EUR) → "Three Thousand Four Hundred Ninety-Nine Euros and Ninety-Nine Cents"



Why You'll Love It:

✅ Saves time—no more manual formatting!

✅ Works with multiple currencies & multiple layers.

✅ Ensures accuracy with real-time previews.

✅ Enhances financial designs, invoices, and pricing tables.


Take your Figma workflow to the next level and never worry about currency formatting again! ⚡️


Perfect for designers working with financial data, pricing tables, or invoices. 🚀

accepted.name: Manas Manohar
accepted.description:
Fintech | Product Designer

I love the process of creation. The process of building something new...

plugins.tagline: Format plain digits to currency instantly! — ₹, $, €, £, and more!

plugins.name: Variable Sherlock 🕵️‍♂️
plugins.description:
Variable Sherlock 🕵️‍♂️


Inspect every variable by selecting any layer in your design. Variable Sherlock will get every used variable in the selection, organized by node and specify its:

  1. Variable name
  2. Property applied to
  3. Type of variable
  4. Value of variable
  5. Collection of variable
  6. Library the collection comes from


You can also filter and sort your results to get specific kinds of variables based on name, type, property, etc.


Notes

  1. It can take some time to inspect large selections. If this happens, try to select a smaller amount of layers.
  2. The shown value reflects the value of the variable in the active mode for the layer it is connected to.
  3. Library names can only be shown if the library is imported to the file the plugin is running in. Otherwise, the library name will be left blank.


I'm always trying to improve the plugin. If this was useful for you have any suggestions or find any bug, don't hesitate to send me a message or buy me a coffee!

accepted.name: Rodrigo Díaz Salvadores
accepted.description: Product Desig Engineer living in Stockholm

plugins.tagline: Inspect used variables in your design: name, type, value, collection & library

plugins.name: DESY
plugins.description:
DESY is your Figma companion, designed for seamless design workflow. It ensures design system compliance, exports clean CSS code, and suggests style guides for a cohesive brand identity.


Design System Compliance

Effortlessly integrate design with development by cross-checking elements against your style guide. Instantly identify and highlight deviations, streamlining design-to-development handoff.


Export CSS

Generate exportable CSS code based on your style library. Consolidate styles into a single stylesheet for consistent updates, simplifying design system edits with auto-generated CSS snippets.


Styleguide Suggestions

Receive intelligent style guide suggestions based on your design file. Enhance your library with curated elements, jumpstarting a well-organized and consistent brand identity.


Why Choose DESY

Enhance collaboration, boost efficiency, and elevate brand consistency with DESY – the ultimate Figma tool for design system management, CSS export, and style guide refinement.
plugins.tagline: Keep your designs, identify styling issues, and streamline the handoff process with DESY

plugins.name: Text Style Creator
plugins.description:
What This Plugin Does

  1. Creates local text styles from any selected text layer
  2. Preserves all typography variable connections (font family, size, weight, etc.)
  3. Automatically finds and applies styles to all matching text layers in the current page


How to Use

  1. Select any text layer that you want to create a style from
  2. Run the plugin


The text style will be named using the content of the selected text layer

The plugin will automatically apply the new style to all text layers with matching properties


Key Features

Supports all typography variables

Batch processing: select multiple text layers to create multiple styles at once

Intelligent matching: finds all text layers with identical properties


Preserves variable connections for:

  1. Font family
  2. Font size
  3. Font style
  4. Font weight
  5. Line height
  6. Letter spacing
  7. Paragraph spacing
  8. Paragraph indent


Note: Make sure your text layers have the desired properties before creating styles, as these will be preserved in the created style.
plugins.tagline: Create local text styles, preserving variable bindings and auto-applying to matching layers.

119401.name: Text Style Creator
119401.description:

119401.tagline: Create local text styles, preserving variable bindings and auto-applying to matching layers.

plugins.name: Variable Agent
plugins.description:
Variable Agent

The plugin is designed to facilitate the management of variable collections within Figma. At the moment, it allows users to copy and paste variable collections, making it easier to manage design tokens and other variable data across different projects and files.


Current Capabilities

- View Variable Collections: Users can view all local variable collections available in Figma.

- Copy Collections: Users can select a variable collection and copy it to their clipboard.

- Paste Collections: Users can paste the copied variable collection into another document or project.


Steps to Use the Plugin in Figma

1. Open the Plugin: Launch the plugin from the Figma plugins menu.

2. View Collections: Upon opening, the plugin will automatically fetch and display all available variable collections.

4. Select a Collection: Use the dropdown menu to select the collection you wish to copy.

5. Copy the Collection: Click the "Copy Collection" button to copy the selected variable collection to your clipboard.

6. Paste the Collection: Navigate to the document where you want to paste the collection, launch the plugin, and click the "Paste Collection" button.

7. Check Status Messages: Monitor the status messages displayed in the plugin for feedback on your actions.


Limitations

- Draft file Support: If you copy a collection with multiple modes, and paste in a file in your draft, it won't work. This is because draft file only support 1 mode.


- Aliased variable collections: The plugin does not currently support pasting variable collections with aliased variables. Aliased variables are those that reference other collection. It will recognize the alias but will not be able to resolve the reference.

accepted.name: Raymond
accepted.description: Strategic Product Designer and Creator of Frames and Divs.

plugins.tagline: Copy and paste variable collection across files and projects

103109.name: Variable Agent

Steps to Use the Plugin in Figma

4. Select a Collection: Use the dropdown menu to select the collection you wish to copy.

6. Paste the Collection: Navigate to the document where you want to paste the collection, launch the plugin, and click the "Paste Collection" button.

7. Check Status Messages: Monitor the status messages displayed in the plugin for feedback on your actions.


Limitations

- Aliased variable collections: The plugin does not currently support pasting variable collections with aliased variables. Aliased variables are those that reference other collection. It will recognize the alias but will not be able to resolve the reference.

plugins.name: Frame move
plugins.description:
Save time and nerves by automating the organization of frames! This tool allows you to quickly select and transfer necessary elements to a separate page with just one click. Important frames will always be at hand and well-structured, ensuring convenience in work and allowing you to focus on creativity and innovation.


Mark the pages: To select the pages for movement, simply click on the button with the "pin" icon to add the [pin] tag to the required pages.


Organize them in one motion: After marking all necessary pages, click on the "Swap" button. This will automatically create a new page named "All Page [date][time]", containing all the previously marked pages with the [pin] tag
plugins.tagline: Simplify project management: fast migration and perfect organization of frames.

Organize them in one motion: After marking all necessary pages, click on the "Swap" button. This will automatically create a new page named "All Page [date][time]", containing all the previously marked pages with the [pin] tag

plugins.description:
Create beautiful card designs effortlessly with the String to Card Generator plugin for Figma! Select a card template, input a list of strings, and let the plugin do the rest. Customize your layout with options to adjust width or height in case of overflow, and choose between vertical or horizontal grid arrangements. Perfect for generating multiple cards quickly and efficiently, this plugin ensures your designs stay organized and visually appealing. Ideal for designers looking to streamline their workflow and produce consistent, high-quality card designs.


simply speaking this plugin will create replicas of your selected design (prototype) with the new data separated by newline.


current limitation is it is only work with single row of text. it can only change texts
plugins.tagline: String to Card Generator

plugins.name: Coordinate
plugins.description:
A simple plugin for quickly targeting nodes and extracting key positional data (X, Y, width, height) for use in other applications.


_Built using [The DataFace's Figma plugin template](https://github.com/the-dataface/figma-plugin-svelte-vite)_


How-to


1. Prefix desired nodes with a uniform string (e.g. `COORDINATE.` or `#` or `@`).

2. Once the plugin is initialized, enter that string in the search box (the default is `COORDINATE`) and run the command.

3. The positional data will show up below in the plugin's UI as JSON. You can download the results directly using the download button in the top-right corner of the results box.

accepted.name: The DataFace
accepted.description: A digital agency, specializing in data visualization

plugins.tagline: Extract coordinates from targeted nodes

plugins.name: Asterisk
plugins.description:
Annotate your designs with Asterisk!


Creating annotations

  1. Annotate to the left, right, above or below a target
  2. Add an optional header
  3. Add optional notes (Shift+Enter to add multiple lines)
  4. Add smaller secondary notes and an optional URL
  5. Customize the spacing between an annotation and its target
  6. Choose the color of an annotation


Global controls

  1. Show/hide all annotations on a page
  2. Lock/unlock all annotations on a page
  3. Delete all annotations on a page
  4. Refresh annotation locations (useful if a component instance inherits changes and moves)


Quality of life features

  1. Annotations follow their targets*
  2. Move an existing annotation to a new target
  3. Change any property of a selected annotation even after it was created
  4. Press Enter after typing in an input to quickly create an annotation
  5. Collapse the UI so you can keep it open but out of the way
  6. Double click any color in the UI to change Asterisk's theme!
  7. Dark mode support


Annotation tuning

  1. Customize annotation max width
  2. Change text size
  3. Show / hide author names on annotations
  4. Apply your tunings to all annotations on a page at once


* Asterisk must be open for annotations to follow their targets
plugins.tagline: Annotations everyone can see

plugins.name: Duckster: Text Styles Scanner
plugins.description:
Perfect for maintaining design consistency and quickly identifying font variations 👌


How it works

  1. Select multiple elements you want to scan.
  2. Run the plugin and click "Analyze".
  3. Instantly view all text styles used within the selected area.
  4. Click on any style to highlight all layers where it appears.


I’d love to hear your feedback and suggestions for improvement.

Wish you organized layouts and clean code! ✨
plugins.tagline: Instantly view all text styles used within the selected area

plugins.name: Bulka
plugins.description:
🥯 Bulka bakes sticky notes from text, in bulk.

  1. Run Bulka
  2. Type, paste, or select text on board
  3. Pick your sticky note color
  4. Smash the button
  5. Each line becomes a separate sticky note


🤍 Creator's favorite use case: Copy a column from a spreadsheet and add it as multiple sticky notes at once. Feels damn good.


💡 Pro tip: Select text on the board, then run the plugin to automatically paste text into Bulka.


🇺🇦 Fun fact: Bulka (бу́лка) is a bread bun in Ukrainian. By sheer coincidence, the English word bulk is part of it. 😉
plugins.tagline: Add FigJam sticky notes. In bulk.

plugins.name: Color Analyzer
plugins.description:
Effortlessly extract and display color values from your designs. This plugin automatically updates text layers with HEX and RGB values from a selected frame or reference layer.


Features include:

  1. Extracts color from frame fill or 'ref color' layer
  2. Updates text layers named 'hex' or 'rgb' with corresponding values
  3. Optional auto-contrast feature adjusts text color for readability
  4. Works with any frame, including those with auto layout
  5. Streamlines color documentation in your design files


Perfect for creating color palettes, style guides, or quickly referencing color values in your designs. Boost your workflow efficiency and ensure color consistency across your projects with this easy-to-use plugin.
plugins.tagline: Color Value Extractor

104450.name: Color Analyzer
104450.description:

plugins.name: Tabletop
plugins.description:
Play board games and card games, right in Figma! This plugin helps with card management, dice rolling, hidden information, and general usability.


Open the playground Figma file for pre-made cards, tokens, and dice!


Features

  1. Sneak a peek at any card or token by selecting it while it is face-down. You will get a preview of the front of the card in your plugin window.
  2. See how many objects you currently have selected.
  3. Flip any number of cards or tokens that you have selected.
  4. Roll any number of dice that you have selected.
  5. Stack objects - this aligns them horizontally and offsets them by 1px vertically, randomizes the layer order, and flips them face-down.
  6. Shuffle objects - this randomizes the layer order of every object you have selected.
  7. Expand a stack of objects - this lays them out side-by-side and flips them face-up, allowing you to quickly see all objects in a stack.
  8. When you select any object, automatically bring it to the top of the layer hierarchy so it appears on top of other objects.


Custom Card & Token Preparation

  1. Create a card or token component that contains a layer named "Front" and a layer named "Back".
  2. Duplicate the component into as many instances as you need for that particular card/token.
  3. Now you can use the Tabletop plugin to manipulate the instances of your cards or tokens!
  4. Optional: Export a PNG image of your "Front" layer, paste it into your component beneath the other layers, and rename it "Preview". This will speed up the preview image that is generated in the plugin when the object is selected.


Custom Dice Preparation

  1. Create a die component that contains at least 2 layers named "Face".
  2. Duplicate the component into as many instances as you need.
  3. Now you can use the Tabletop plugin to roll your dice!


Feedback Needed!

I'm actively working on this plugin, so please leave comments with feedback and I'll try to refine and add features accordingly.

accepted.name: Colin Brandt
accepted.description:
Full-time product designer at Microsoft
Free-time game designer

plugins.tagline: Play board games and card games, right in Figma! This plugin helps with card management and more.

105047.release_notes:
-Added dice rolling
-New playground Figma file
-Simplified the requirements for having valid card and token objects (no more need for a special boolean property)
-Improved notification behavior so they no longer queue up
105047.tagline: Play board games and card games, right in Figma! This plugin helps with card management and more.

plugins.name: African Name Generator
plugins.description:
African Name Generator Plugin


What It Does

The African Name Generator plugin helps you quickly add authentic African names to your designs. You can generate and insert first names, last names, or full names from Nigeria, Kenya, Ghana, South Africa, and Ethiopia.


How to Use It

1. Open the Plugin: Find and launch the African Name Generator plugin in your Figma plugins menu.

2. Select Parameters:

- Country: Choose Nigeria, Kenya, Ghana, South Africa, Ethiopia, Egypt, Senegal, Uganda, Tanzania, Morocco, and Cameroon.

- Gender: Pick male or female.

- Name Type: Select first name, last name, or full name.

3. Generate Name: Click the "Generate Name" button. The name will appear in the plugin.

4. Insert Name:

- Select a text layer in your Figma file.

- Click the "Insert Name" button. The plugin will insert the name into the selected text layer.


Limitations

- Name List: The names come from a fixed list. Not every African name is included.

- Font Support: The plugin uses fonts available in Figma. Ensure the desired font is available.

- Single Text Layer: Insert names into one text layer at a time. Repeat the process for multiple layers.


The African Name Generator plugin allows you to easily add real African names to your designs.

accepted.name: Joseph Kalu
accepted.description: I am a fintech and crypto product designer

plugins.tagline: Generate Unique African Names for your designs

4. Insert Name:

The African Name Generator plugin allows you to easily add real African names to your designs.
95343.tagline: Generate Unique African Names for your designs

plugins.name: PixaSchedule
plugins.description:
PixaSchedule is a simple and user-friendly Figma plugin designed to make creating and editing stream schedules easier. It helps bridge the gap between users and artists by providing tools to create clean and organized schedules with minimal effort.


Key features:

  1. Week Picker
  2. Day Schedule Editor
  3. Schedule Style Selector (Offline, Single Title, Two Titles, Title with Caption)


Information:

  1. You can download preset template / finished samples here.
  2. Editing tutorial video is on progress.
  3. Cleaner version of preset template is on progress.
  4. More information / suggestion please contact me here.
plugins.tagline: Customize schedule easily
